turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: We made a deal with Barrack One.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Any news on Dunbar?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: He's still in the Kommandant's office. That's all I know.

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Do Cagney. Like you did yesterday.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: There was that ammunition train in the depot at Frankfurt, see? So Dunbar gets himself in the men's room and fixes a time bomb, see? Then he waits until the train starts moving out, see? And one of the cars got the door open with some straw on the floor, see? So he throws it, see, and three minutes later -- voom! See?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Throws what? How could he have a time bomb?

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Just pulled the old match gag, see!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: What's the match gag?

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Take some matches, see?  And a cigarette, see?  Tuck the cigarette in like this, see?  Now the cigarette keeps burning like a fuse, see?

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: Where's Hoffy? Why don't we get any news about Dunbar?

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Don't worry. He'll be all right.

turns.speaker: BAGRADIAN
turns.text: I had to be the ham! I had to shoot off my mouth!

turns.speaker: PRICE
turns.text: Forget it. He'll be back here. They've got no proof.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: They ought to be under the barbed wire soon.

turns.speaker: BLONDIE
turns.text: Looks good outside.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: BLONDIE
turns.text: Static!

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: BLONDIE
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Okay. Move on.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Three's a crowd, especially if you've got to cut your way through barbed wire.  Here's the wire cutters.  Are the civilian clothes ready?

turns.speaker: BLONDIE
turns.text: Coming up.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Get going on the trap door.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: W-w-will that do or do you want some m-m-m --?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: That'll do.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: There's only one pair left.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: We'll get some more.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: What's the matter? You on their team now? You think I'm the guy?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: I don't know anymore.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: I understand how you feel, Cookie. It's sort of rough -- one American squealing on other Americans. Then again, Cookie -- maybe that stoolie's not an American at all. Maybe he's a German the Krauts planted in this barracks. They do this type of thing. Just put an agent in with us -- a trained specialist. Lots of loose information floating around a prison camp. Not just whether somebody wants to escape, but what outfits we were with and where we were stationed, and how our radar operates. Could be, couldn't it?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: In this barracks?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Why not? Just one of the boys. Sharing our bunks. Eating our chow. Right in amongst the ones that beat me up. Except that he beat hardest.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: That's not the point, Cookie. The point is what do you do with him? You tip your mitt and the Jerries pull him out of here and plant him someplace else, like Stalag Sixteen or Fifteen. Or you kill him off and the Krauts turn around and kill off the whole barracks. Every one of us. So what do you do?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: If you don't want to tell me, why don't you tell Hoffy? Or Security?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Yeah. Security.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: So long, Cookie. The department store is all yours. What's left of it.

turns.speaker: COOKIE
turns.text: So long, Sefton.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Now what kind of a crack is that?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: No crack. Two packs of cigarettes say they don't get out of the forest.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Hold it, Sefton. So we heard some shots -- so who says they didn't get away?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Anybody here wanna double their bet?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Private property, bub.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: How come the Krauts knew about that stove, Security? And the tunnel? How come you can't lay down a belch around here without them knowing it?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Come on, Trader Horn! Let's hear it: what'd you give the Krauts for that egg?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Forty-five cigarettes. The price has gone up.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Nice guy! The Krauts shoot Manfredi and Johnson last night and today he's out trading with them.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Look, this may be my last hot breakfast on account of they're going to take away that stove. So will you let me eat it in peace?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: What's your beef, boys? So I'm trading. Everybody here is trading. Only maybe I trade a little sharper. So that makes me a collaborator.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: A lot sharper, Sefton! I'd like to have some of that loot you got in those footlockers!

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: You would, would you? Listen, Stupe -- the first week I was in this joint somebody stole my Red Cross package, my blanket and my left shoe. Well, I wised up since. This ain't no Salvation Army -- this is everybody for himself. Dog eat dog.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You stink, Sefton!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Static is right! The radio's static, Patton's static, we're static!

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Maybe it's going to be a longer war than you figured -- eh, Duke?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: I suppose they also know about your distillery and the horseraces?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Just what makes you and them Krauts so buddy-buddy?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Ask Security.  You tell him, Price. You've got me shadowed every minute of the day. Or haven't you found out yet?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: I grease the Kraut guards. With ten percent of the take.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: And maybe a little something else?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: A little something what?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Yeah, what about it?  Cut the horsing around. We know he's the stoolie and we know what the pay- off is. Let's get on with it.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Let's get on with what? What is this anyway? A Kangaroo Court? Why don't you get a rope and do it right?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You make my mouth water.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: You're all wire happy, boys. You've been in this camp too long. You put two and two together and it comes out four. Only it ain't four.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: What are you looking at him for?  Any objections, Sefton?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Take it.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Next we're going to auction off your department store -- and your stable.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Have a cigar.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: I wouldn't worry about Schulz. I'd worry about Sefton. Remember me? I'm the stoolie.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You ain't going to squeal this one, brother.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: No? Aren't you a little afraid to turn the stoolie loose on that compound? For a tip-off like this, you know what the Krauts would pay?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Here's the knife to do it with. Only make sure you got the right throat.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: We're looking at it.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Brother, were we all wet about you!

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Put me down for ten, you louse.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: I'll call the whole pot.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Don't ask me. Price was elected Security.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Okay, Security -- what happened?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You betcha. I said one of us is a stoolie. A dirty, stinkin' stoolie!

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Break it off!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: How much more do we have to take from him?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: There'll be no vigilante stuff. Not while I'm Barrack Chief.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: How did he get over there?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Easy! Walked right through the gate, past the guard. Like he was some Kraut Field Marshal.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: The S.S. Men are here to pick up Dunbar. They're taking him to Berlin. Looks like he's finished.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Only he ain't quite finished yet. Blondie -- get that smudge pot. Tie it to Steve's leg.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Then we're all in on it?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Everybody but Joey, and you know who.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: You killed them, huh? Both of them?

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Such nice boys! It makes me sick to --

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Don't wear it out!

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Cut out the guff, Schulz. We're on to you. You know everything that's happening in this barrack. Who's tipping you off?

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Tipping me off? I do not understand.

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: Come on, Schulz! Spill it! How did you get the information? About Manfredi and Johnson? About the stove and the tunnel? Who's giving it to you? Which one of us is it?

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Which one of you is what?

turns.speaker: DUKE
turns.text: That's the general idea.  Only it's not so general as far as I'm concerned.

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: You are talking crazy!

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Lieutenant Dunbar? It wouldn't be James Schuyler Dunbar? From Boston?

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Yes, it would. Do we know each other?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Maybe he would. We applied for Officers' Training together, remember? They turned me down, but I'm glad to see you made it. Of course, it couldn't be that all that dough behind you had something to do with it!  His mother's got twenty million dollars.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Twenty-five.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: They've got a summer house in Nantucket, with an upstairs polo field.  You better put a canopy over his bunk.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: What did you expect, glamor boy? The Officers' Club with a steam room and a massage maybe?

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Just a minute. You made a couple of cracks before and I let them slide. But I don't intend to take any more. If you resent my having money, start a revolution, but get off my back.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Look, Lieutenant. All your dough won't help you here. Because here you're on your own. And no mother to throw you a lifebelt. Now let's see how good you can swim.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Shut off the moaning, or we'll have the dogs on us. Shut it off, Lieutenant. This is orders!

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: My legs are frozen.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: You'd better get that blue blood circulating, because we're busting out of this stink-hole in exactly --  -- one minute and twenty seconds.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Sefton!

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: What did you expect, a St. Bernard dog?

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Not you.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: What some brandy?

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Who doesn't! Suppose we wait until we hit the Waldorf Astoria.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: It's on me.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: You won't get off that cheap.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: What are the chances busting out of here?

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: We'll know in forty seconds.  Only in a democracy can a poor guy get his keister shot off with a rich guy.

turns.speaker: SEFTON
turns.text: Let's blow, Chauncey.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Let's!

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I am Lieutenant Dunbar.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: What is your number?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: That is correct.  Lieutenant Dunbar, I came to apologize for the accommodations. Ordinarily, of course, we never put officers up with enlisted men.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I'll live.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Quite a transportation jam we are having outside of Frankfurt! They are very angry in Berlin. They will be even angrier on the East Front, waiting for that ammunition train. Don't you think so, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about, Colonel.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Of course you don't. Now, Lieutenant, how would you like to join me in my quarters? I have a nice fire going.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I'm okay here. Why bother?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: No bother. I'm very grateful for a little company. You see, I suffer from insomnia.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: Ever try forty sleeping pills?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Abfuehren!

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: You have no idea how boring my life here is. If it weren't for an occasional air raid or some foolish prisoners trying to escape, I wouldn't know what to do. I want to thank you for keeping me company. I don't drink, I don't smoke, I don't read. I hate music. That only leaves good conversation. It will be a shame to lose you.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I didn't do it -- I didn't do it.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Of course you did! Twenty-six carloads of munitions gone off like a trick cigar! The S.S. is running around in circles. The Gestapo is arresting the wrong people. And von Scherbach has caught the fish. Most amusing, isn't it?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: You are being rude again.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I want to sleep. Give me five minutes on that couch.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Nine-thirty. General von Pfeffinger should be at his desk by now. Shall we call Berlin and tell him the good news?

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I didn't do it. I didn't do it.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: There will be two S.S. men here tomorrow to take you to Berlin. You will be interrogated by the General Staff. When you come to the part about your arrest, I'm sure you won't forget to give me the proper credit.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I want to sleep... I haven't slept for three days.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: You will remember the name? Von Scherbach? VON SCHER-BACH!

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: I didn't do it. I was in the Frankfurt station and the train was three miles away when it blew up.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Oh, come now! You threw a time bomb.

turns.speaker: DUNBAR
turns.text: How could I have had a time bomb? They searched me when they took me prisoner.

turns.speaker: GERMAN LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Here we have a typical barrack. It houses seventy-five men. Every one of them has his own bunk, naturally.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: Naturally. It would be rather awkward to have three men in one bunk.

turns.speaker: GERMAN LIEUTENANT
turns.text: As for the blankets, you will notice they are very warm. Fifty percent wool.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: They also smell of moth balls.  When were they issued? This morning?

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: What do you do for heat in this barrack? No stove?

turns.speaker: GERMAN LIEUTENANT
turns.text: The men here used it for a trap door, so we had to remove it temporarily.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: How long is temporarily? I trust not until July.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Well, Herr Inspector! How did you find the camp? Crowded but gemuetlich, shall we say?

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: I want to talk about Lieutenant Dunbar. Is this Lieutenant Dunbar?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: It is.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: What exactly is he charged with?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Whatever it is, it's out of your jurisdiction. This man is not a prisoner of war. Not any more. He is a saboteur.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: He is a prisoner of war until you can prove sabotage.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: And the way you search your prisoners, it does sound rather unlikely.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: All I know is he did it. I am satisfied.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: I am not. According to the Geneva Convention --

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: You were saying --?

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: Simply this. After the hostilities are ended, there will be such a thing as a War Crimes Commission. If this man should be convicted without proper proof, you will be held responsible, Colonel von Scherbach.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Interesting.

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: Isn't it?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Very well. If you insist on details. I have ways of finding out about that blasted time bomb. Good day, sir.  You will forgive me for receiving you like this?

turns.speaker: GENEVA MAN
turns.text: Perfectly all right. I do not like boots.

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Aufstehen, gentlemen! Please! You do not want to stay in bed on such a beautiful morning we are having today!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Say, Schulz --

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Jawohl?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sprechen Sie deutsch?

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Jawohl.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Then droppen Sie dead!

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Ja -- ja! Droppen Sie dead! Always mit the jokes! Droppen Sie dead!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Jawohl!

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Some are not bad at all.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wisecrackers? Where did he pick up his English? In a pretzel factory?

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: You always think I am a square. I have been to America.  I wrestled in Milwaukee and St. Louis and Cincinnati. And I will go back! The way the war is going I will be there before you!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You should live so long.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, Schulz! I got a deal for you. Suppose you help us escape. We'll go home and have everything ready for you in Madison Square Garden. For the world championship! Schulz, the Beast of Bavaria versus Halitosis Jones!

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Droppen Sie dead!  Raus mit dem Ofen. Los! Los!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why don't we accept, Animal? The worst that can happen is we wind up a couple of lamp shades.

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: Raus! Raus! All of you!

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: What is this? This is water?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's a mouse trap.

turns.speaker: SCHULTZ
turns.text: And this?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: When you get going on those broads, think of me!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Animal! Animal! Aren't you ashamed of yourself? A couple of guys are trying to escape and you're thinking of broads. Broads?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Shut up, Animal!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Maybe they were layin' for 'em out there!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Good morning, Animal! What'll it be for breakfast? Scrambled eggs with little sausages? Bacon and eggs sunny- side up? Griddle cakes? A waffle?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Stop it, Harry!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Coffee? Milk? Or how about a little cocoa?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Why do you do this to me every morning?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hamburger and onions! Strawberry shortcake! Gefillte fish! Banana split! French fried potatoes! Chicken a la king!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: I'll kill you, Harry -- so help me!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let go, Animal! It's roll call! Hitler wants to see you!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: 'We will remove the iron stove -- the one that was camouflaging the trap door.'

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm telling you, Animal, these Nazis ain't Kosher.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You can say that again!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm telling you, Animal -- these Nazis ain't Ko --

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: I said say it again. I didn't say repeat it.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Hey -- Russki -- Russki! Look at those bublichkis! Over here!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Comrade! Comrade! Otchi Tchorniya -- Otchi Tchorniya!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Look at me! I'm your baby!  Get a load of that blonde one! Built like a brick Kremlin!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey -- Comrade! Over here! This is Harry Shapiro -- the Volga Boatman of Barrack four!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Lay off! The blonde is mine!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Let me go! Let me go!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: They'll shoot you, Animal!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's chow, Animal! Chow!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Who wants to eat? I just wanna get over there!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No you don't! You don't want any broads with boots on!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: I don't care if they wear galoshes!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You want Betty Grable!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Let me go!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Betty Grable!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Animal! When the war's over, remember I told you I'd fix you up with Betty Grable!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Yeah? How you going to fix me up with Betty Grable?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How? We go to California. I got a cousin that's working for the Los Angeles Gas Company. That's how we get the address, see? Isn't that clever? I take you up to her house and ring the doorbell and say, 'Congratulations, Miss Grable. We have voted you the girl we'd most like to be behind barbed wire with, and I'm here to present the award'.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: What's the award?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What d'ya think, jerko! You're the award!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Me? What if she don't want me?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: If she don't want you, she don't get anything.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You're teasing me again!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let go, Animal! It's chow! We'll miss chow!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No, Animal.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No. Your eyeball goes. The top of your head. Gotta wind up with athlete's stomach.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Easy, Animal! Easy!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Where'd that come from?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't you remember, Animal? A chicken lays those things.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: It's beautiful!  You goin' to eat it all yourself?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Thanks. You're a real pal!  What're we goin' to do with it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Plant it, Animal, and grow us a chicken for Christmas.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Ain't that too bad! Tomorrow he'll have to suck a raw egg!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He don't have to worry. He'll trade the Krauts for a six-burner gas range. Maybe a deep freeze too.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wunderbar! Isn't he wunderbar!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: He's the grrrrreatest!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Equipoise! Equipoise! What did I tell you, Animal?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Come on, baby! Daddy's going to buy you a hunk of cheese!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Schnickelfritz! I told you Schnickelfritz! Why'd you make me bet on Equipoise!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I clocked him this morning. He was running like a doll.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You clocked him! Why don't I clock you?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Look at her! Isn't she beautiful! Married an orchestra leader!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So what? There's other women!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Not for me! Betty! Betty!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Cut it out. Animal! I'll fix you up with a couple of those Russian women!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You'll fix me up!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sure, Animal! I'll get you over there!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: How? Pinky Miller from Barrack 8 tried to get over there and they shot him in the leg!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It takes a gimmick, Animal, and I figured us a little gimmick.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sharp. Sometimes I'm so sharp it's frightening.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: To the Brick Kremlin!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: She'll never forgive me!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Bombs away!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Harry -- I'm blind!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Blind? How stupid can you get, Animal? I drank the stuff myself.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: What do those broads say?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What do they always say?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: That's what I wanna hear.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's not good for you, Animal.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Hey! This is with a typewriter! It's from a finance company!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So it is from the finance company. So it's better than no letter at all. So they want the third payment on the Plymouth.  So they want the fourth, the fifth, the sixth and the seventh. So they want the Plymouth.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Sugar-lips Shapiro! Frightening, ain't it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This is a good one!  Shut up, everybody! Listen to this!  'The President of the United States to Harry Shapiro. Greeting: Having submitted yourself to a local board, you are hereby notified to report...' What do you know! So now I'm a draft evader!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That Schulz pig. I'll get him yet.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You hold him. I'll slug him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why don't we just look in those footlockers?

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Come on, you little stooge. Hand over them keys.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Grable, not Gable!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Do Jimmy Durante!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Do Grable.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, here's Esther Williams.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: There, Joey -- ain't that better than being a lawyer?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Animal! Got a little something for you!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'll open mine now.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: I'll open mine, too.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Come on, Animal -- let's trip the light fantastic!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Let me alone.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're crying, Animal.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: It's that song, Harry!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't want to cry over a dame that doesn't even know you're alive! Snap out of it!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: There's a time in every man's life when he wants to be alone! So go away!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: May I have this dance, Miss?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why, sure!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: But it's not just those legs. It's that nose of yours I'm crazy about. That cute little button of a nose!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, Animal! Animal!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: I've been crazy about you for years. I've seen every picture you've ever made six times. I'd just sit there and never even open that popcorn bag.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Animal! Animal! Wake up!

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: Betty! Betty!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This is me, Animal! It's Harry Shapiro!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let me do it, Hoffy.

turns.speaker: STOSH
turns.text: You want to go?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No. I want to draw.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Sergeant Hoffman from Barrack 4.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Yes, Sergeant Hoffman?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: As the duly elected Compound Chief, I protest the way these bodies are left lying in the mud.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Anything else?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Yes. According to the Geneva Convention, dead prisoners are to be given a decent burial.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Of course. I'm aware of the Geneva Convention. They will be given the burial they deserve. Or perhaps you would suggest we haul in twenty-one cannons from the Eastern Front and give them a twenty-one gun salute?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Good evening, Sergeants.  A bit dank in here, isn't it?... Where is the Baracken-Fuehrer?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: You have a Lieutenant here...

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: ...a Lieutenant James Dunbar?

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: HOFFY
turns.text: Wait a minute. We have some rights here.  Why is this man being taken out?

turns.speaker: VON SCHERBACH
turns.text: Curtains would do wonders for this barrack.  You will not get them.
